website_summaries.verdict: A luxury pool noodle for those who want reliable weight support with a fun, decorative design.
pros: Many owners like using these noodles for aquatic exercises
Remarkably flexible despite its sturdy design
cons: Some noodles arrived already cracked from shipping
More expensive than other comparable models

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: Lounged around the lazy river at the hotel and it held up great. Even my kids wanted to use it. I thought I was the only one to have one at the pool until I found one other vacationer in the pool who also had one. A must have for a big guy and I'm 6'5 270lbs. and it holds me just fine. Update: It is holding up well. I need to buy a few more.
customer_reviews.author: The Beard

customer_reviews.title: Worthy investment
customer_reviews.text: We have used fluid pool noodles for five years now, usually replace them every 1.5 years. We use them year round - outdoors during summer and in a heated pool during winter, 3-5 times per week. They are worth the investment, provide great buoyancy for weight above 100 lbs. Best to lay flat for storage, keep unweighted while drying out. If the outer plastic gets even a small hole, the foam underneath will take on water. Love the two tone!
customer_reviews.author: dale dawson

customer_reviews.title: Similar to less expensive noodles
customer_reviews.text: We don't see any difference between this noodle at about $20 more than other similar noodles purchased at the same time Update: this noodle is no better/or worse than the WOW noodles which are about $25 less
customer_reviews.author: S. P.

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: Love love love. Best noodles ever. Can't float? Get one of these. Even my husband likes it and he doesn't go much for noodles... So much so that I will not let my nieces and nephews use for fear they will damage it. It is for me and my hubby only! Selfish you say? No way. Get one and you will see you won't want anyone to touch it! Not sure if it is fragile, but it does stick together to the other when stored. I started bringing them into the house, storing in A/C, not in the garage. I'll be upset the day it tears.
customer_reviews.author: Bene G

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage for the money. Within the first pool day these were already splitting! We bought a cheaper version and those are holding up much better than this. I would have returned it, had it not been for me missing the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Split at the seam before even getting wet
customer_reviews.text: Showed up quickly but was disappointed to open it and find that the seam was already splitting, haddent even had it in the water yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Blake

customer_reviews.title: Not Your Typical Noodle
customer_reviews.text: Second season with these Noodles and they are doing great. Read the storage directions as they can’t be thrown together and must be kept from touching each other. One note....use clear silicone adhesive to fix any scrapes before soaking them if possible.
customer_reviews.author: jfachatz

customer_reviews.title: Soft and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Love it. A little expensive, but it has a nice soft feel and should last many pool seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Ron in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart within a year!
customer_reviews.text: When we first bought it we liked it but after about 6 months the outer layer started cracking and it became useless not long after that. I do not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Great for physical therapy!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my physical therapy on the floor. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Oneshellverp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Pool Exercising
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great for exercising in the pool So many ways you can use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann M. Whiteman

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Two different lengths. Black stains on one. Do not like product at all!! Not happy! Would not recommend at all!
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Hart

customer_reviews.title: Envy of the pool !!
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughter loves this noodle !! She was the envy of the pool !!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great float for the value
customer_reviews.text: Came in a long box the length of the noodle and was shrink wrapped to compact it a little. Great float for the value!
customer_reviews.author: Kim B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, durable and will last you longer than one season!
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: These are much better than the skinny ones.
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren love these pool noodles. They call them Golly Noodles. They are the most popular noodles I own.
customer_reviews.author: UtahBee

customer_reviews.title: i need to return due to marks on the float ...
customer_reviews.text: i need to return due to marks on the float OR I WILL ACCEPT A CREDIT FOR PART OF THE PRICE AND KEEP THIS ONE. CHOICE IS YOURS. ERROLL erroll6676@att.net let me know
customer_reviews.author: Erroll

customer_reviews.title: Go to Costco!
customer_reviews.text: I have about 6 of these but paid less than half when available at Costco! No way am I paying $80 for one of these. Ridiculous. They last longer than those foam ones; but once they get ripped; they soak up water; and you better patch them up with a hot glue gun or adhesive sealer
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: fyi .. same brand @ Costco fpr $30
customer_reviews.text: love the noodle! just not the price! not attempting to cause any issues, but literally, the exact same noodle ! Costco for $30 .. hek, the price diff, pretty much pays for the membership.
customer_reviews.author: Pagzzer0
